comments: The coefficient a for which y=a*sqrt(x) kisses the exponential function y=exp(x). The kissing point is (0.5, sqrt(e)). For more details, see A257776. Also, inverse of this constant equals the maximum value of sqrt(x)*exp(-x) for positive x, attained at x=1/2. - _Stanislav Sykora_, Nov 04 2015
links: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
